intro: Liabum sandemanii, commonly known as the sandemanii sedge, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Cyperaceae, which includes sedges and related plants. The plant typically grows in wet, marshy habitats and features narrow, grass-like leaves. Its small, inconspicuous flowers are arranged in spikelets, characteristic of the sedge family. Liabum sandemanii is often used in ornamental landscaping due to its attractive appearance and adaptability to moist environments.
